text: Chromyl chloride, also known as chromium oxychloride is a chemical compound. It has the formula CrO2Cl2. It is a red liquid. It is made by reacting hydrochloric acid with chromium(VI) oxide or potassium chromate. It is a strong oxidizing agent. When it is mixed with sulfur it oxidizes it. It is the result of a test for chloride. It is toxic because it contains chromium in its +6 oxidation state, and its fumes can irritate the eyes. It can also burn the skin and can cause cancer. It also contains some hydrochloric acid. It reacts with grease and some plastics. ==Related pages== *Chromic acid *Chromate *Dichromate == References == Category:Chlorides Category:Chromium compounds Category:Oxides
title: Chromyl chloride
